body_html:
Hi @BinhangYuan,

You're right that we changed the TensorBoard build system a lot. We no longer use node and associated tooling, we found it was really hard to keep multiple build systems synchronized, since we were using bazel internally and node externally. The result was a really painful build process in open source.

Now, as you can see at DEVELOPMENT.md, we simply use bazel for everything :)
body_text:
Hi @BinhangYuan,
You're right that we changed the TensorBoard build system a lot. We no longer use node and associated tooling, we found it was really hard to keep multiple build systems synchronized, since we were using bazel internally and node externally. The result was a really painful build process in open source.
Now, as you can see at DEVELOPMENT.md, we simply use bazel for everything :)
body:
Hi @BinhangYuan,

You're right that we changed the TensorBoard build system a lot. We no longer use node and associated tooling, we found it was really hard to keep multiple build systems synchronized, since we were using bazel internally and node externally. The result was a really painful build process in open source.

Now, as you can see at [DEVELOPMENT.md](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorboard/blob/master/DEVELOPMENT.md), we simply use bazel for everything :)
